text:
New tourism businesses join Canadian Signature Experiences collection Published on : Wednesday, July 8, 2015
Destination Canada (DC) is delighted to announce three new members to the Canadian Signature Experiences (CSE) collection. These new experiences add an extra layer of diversity to an already rich DC-led program designed to appeal to international travellers.
The 2015 debutants are:
· Spring Caribou Migration at Arctic Haven Wilderness Adventures on Ennadai Lake, NU: Watch one of nature’s rare events, as hundreds of thousands of Qamanirjuaq caribou sweep north to their calving grounds. · Historic Li-lik-hel Mine Expedition at Copper Cayuse Outfitters in Pemberton, BC: Take a three-day horseback expedition into BC’s gold-mining past. · The Rat’s Nest Adventure Tour at Canmore Cave Tours in Canmore, AB: During a spelunker’s delight travellers can climb, crawl, slither and rappel on a guided tour.
“Our government recognizes the important contribution that tourism makes to the Canadian economy,” said the Honourable Maxime Bernier, Minister of State (Small Business and Tourism, and Agriculture). “Through the Canadian Signature Experiences collection, tourism entrepreneurs do a great job showcasing to the world everything our country has to offer, while creating jobs and growth here at home.”
The new additions take the total CSE member list to 186. These unique, once-in-a-lifetime travel experiences from urban gems and active nature pursuits to wilderness and wildlife encounters and connecting with Canada’s people and past—differentiate our country in the international tourism marketplace. The program forms an integral part of Canada’s Federal Tourism Strategy.
“Our goal is to make Canada an easy destination to buy, to enjoy and to tell others about,” says David F. Goldstein, Destination Canada President and CEO. “Canadian Signature Experiences help do that by putting some of our industry’s most innovative products front and centre in the window. Along the way, the CSE program helps inspire more entrepreneurs to rise to a new level of international competitiveness.”
The CSE program is a brand-alignment and market-development program that is changing international perceptions of travel within Canada. It expands global travellers’ horizons as to what Canada has to offer by highlighting those experiences that target their interests. In a new partnership, DC works closely with all 13 Canadian provincial and territorial marketing organizations (PMOs) to build and maintain the list of members.Businesses that want to become part of the program should apply through their PMO.
